There is one love I should never have crossed

Back in 1960-1962, while John Lennon was married to Cynthia, he had an affair with a fantastic friend of the Beatles named Patricia Inder. Before a gig one day in Cavern club, John Lennon asked to marry Patricia. Later on, found out that his wife is having a baby (Julian). The baby news disrupted his plans with Patricia, so he had to let her go and care for the child. Patricia was distraught and angry at John until three years later; they meet again before a gig, and Patricia states that John saw her and said, “It’s the love of my life” She meant so much to him, and he knew this love was one he should not have crossed.

I’m a loser
 I’m a loser

“I’m a Loser” was written in 1964 during John’s “Fat Elvis” period where he became heavily depressed. He explained this during a 1980 interview with Playboy:

When ‘Help!’ came out, I was actually crying out for help. Most people think it’s just a fast rock ‘n’ roll song. I didn’t realise it at the time; I just wrote the song because I was commissioned to write it for the movie. But later, I knew I really was crying out for help. So it was my fat Elvis period.

When asked about the song, John said:

Part of me suspects that I’m a loser and the other part of me thinks I’m God Almighty.
My tears are falling like rain from the sky
John is using a simile. Rain falls very fast and very hard. Similarly, he is crying torrential tears – he is very upset.
I’m telling you so that you won’t lose all
John’s life has fallen apart, so he’s warning you to pay more attention to your girlfriend and stop taking her for granted.
And so it’s true, pride comes before a fall

Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.
Proverbs 16:18

John has discovered that overconfidence often leads to the destruction of what you are so confident about.
And I’m not what I appear to be
“I’m A Loser” is a very upbeat and cheerful song. This is just a facade, a mask – it’s actually a very sad song, as evidenced by the lyrics.
